data.title: Metaballs (alpha threshold)
data.body: Someone in the IRC channel linked this page: https://www.scirra.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=74372&start=0. Don't know how difficult to implement it would be, but seems like a very very nice addition to have around for the particles especially. Consider this as an enhancement please? :)

data.title: Bind TileMap::is_cell_transposed
data.body: Closes #3724.

data.title: Nonexistent function 'is_cell_transposed' in base 'TileMap'
data.body:
I wan't to get the rotation off tile in tilemap and got this error message.
_Invalid call. Nonexistent function 'is_cell_transposed' in base 'TileMap'._

Function seams available but not in editor help and code completion.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/13061283/552dedd8-d437-11e5-8d51-7c95f8628354.png)

Godot Version: Godot_v2.0_rc1_20160209_win64.exe
System: Windows 7 64bit

data.title: Topmost(root?) node not editable after creation.
data.body:
Maybe this has been discussed before, but it was not clear in the docs, and it does annoy me a bit at times.
By topmost i mean the very first node/whatever-item you create, i called it root, but so many different things get named root in godot that i'm not sure it is the correct name for it.

So, after you create the very first item, nothing can be done to it, the only way to alter it is by deletion, which in practice means that i end up creating an empty node to start and then re-organize everything bellow it as i see fit.

If this is intended, and a design choice, it should be explicitly mentioned in the docs, preferably in the sceneTree docs, in the basics section.

I'm guessing that it is because its a pretty considerable thing to be a bug, or a unintended side-effect of whatnot.
Either way this issue is either a feature request, or a docs request.

data.title: fix joystick axis handling for Input.is_action_pressed()
data.body: fixes #3718

data.title: AnimationPlayer.set_speed() does not set the relative speed of the animation
data.body:
Tried this code in an animation on Debian Jessie, 2.0, RC1

```
extends AnimationPlayer
var bMoving=true
var speed=5.0

func _ready():
    set_speed(speed)
    print(get_speed())

```

result was 1.0 instead of expected 5.0.
Seems as if the method does not change the relative speed.

data.title: Feature Request - Copy, Cut, Paste scene nodes
data.body:
Copy / Cut, Paste nodes would be a tremendous time saver.

Right now I have to add my components ( sub-scenes ) and re-enter script variables in Property Editor over and over. If I could copy / paste selected node trees between scenes, I would be very happy.

I'm sure many other users miss this ability.

data.title: Moving KinematicBody2D can recieve physics events
data.body:
I have a platform and a player, both are KinematicBody2D's. The player is constantly pushed towards the ground (gravity) with `KinematicBody2D.move`. When the player stands onto the platform which is patrolling between two points, it starts to slowly "push" down with the player. 
This does not occour with platforms that are completely still.

To my understanding this shouldn't happen, referring to the documentations at [http://docs.godotengine.org/](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/tutorials/2d/physics_introduction.html#kinematicbody2d)

> "They are not affected by the physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigidbody, these are the same as a staticbody) --"

There is a workaround for this, and it is to check weather the player could actually move towards the ground with `KinematicBody2D.test_move` and, not move it unless it could move. This is in some cases preferable, but it should be fixed nevertheless.

data.title: Input actions mapped to joystick axes don't work with is_action_pressed
data.body: You can get those through InputEvents in the input callback, but `Input.is_action_pressed()` doesn't work with joystick axes.

data.title: [Editor] File System
data.body:
It looks like when you create a new folder in godot it messes up the file system in the editor. It seems to duplicate the directories under other folders as seen on the image below.

Reproduce:
- save a new scene
- at the top right click on create new folder
- create your folder
- save your scene inside of the new folder
- look at the file system section
  ![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5507549/13056763/5a1422b0-d3e5-11e5-897d-ece4281fc235.PNG)

data.title: AnimationPlayer.is_playing() not showing correct status in _process
data.body:
tested the following sequence:

```
print(is_playing())   ->  "false"
play("anyAnimation")   ->  "true"
// while animation is palying
print(is_playing())   ->  "true"
// after animation is stopped
print(is_playing())   ->  "true"      error!!
```

seems to not be triggered back to false status after animation is finished.
(Debian jessie amd_64 - godot 2.0 RC1)

data.title: Little typo in the import_textures wiki page
data.body:
It starts with

"Do NOT to import them in most cases."

Which sounds wrong. Should be: 

"Do NOT import them in most cases."

or

"in most cases you should no import them"

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer does not properly animate transform properties when using Normal Tracks
data.body:
#### Problem
- Create a Skeleton
- Attach a hierarchy of BoneAttachment
- Create an animation using AnimationPlayer
- Using Normal Tracks, modify/insert keyframes for position/rotation of the various BoneAttachment nodes
- Play animation using the AnimationPlayer, and everything works as expected

Then,
- Create AnimationTreePlayer
- Specify the "Master Player" as the previously created AnimationPlayer, modifying the base node if necessary.
- In the nodegraph editor, create an Animation Node to output into the Out node
- Click play in AnimationTreePlayer editor, and all bones affected in the animation have their transforms reset to 0.

---
#### Specs
- **OS:** Windows 7 x64
- **Godot Build Version:** https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/ad405ade17630c927e06530dbbaad4e730193774
- **Graphics Card:** Nvidia 660 Ti (Driver: v10.18.13.5891)

---
#### Example Project

I included some helpful controls for ease of debugging while the game is playing, just for posterity.

[AnimationTreePlayer.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/130077/AnimationTreePlayer.zip)

---
#### Unnecessarily complex example video

This is an example video of the project that I originally discovered the issue in, and then stripped down to make the example project above. As such, it's far more complex than the example project, but it still gives a good example of showcasing the issue at hand.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AcAKR65RNEA

data.title: x11: make dependancy on libudev optional
data.body:
fixes #3702
Udev monitoring can be optionally enabled by compiling with `udev=yes`, removes the `gamepad` flag.
Else, we loop through `/dev/input/event0` to `event31` once per second to discover new devices.
Disconnection should be instant.

ping @punto-

data.title: Texture button has no built-in texture resize option
data.body:
The texture button rect resizes but there is no option to auto-stretch it.
Currently I'm using this code on func _ready():
set_texture_scale(Vector2(get_rect().size.x/get_minimum_size().x, get_rect().size.y/get_minimum_size().y))

It works flawlessly as far as i've tested, but for newcomers it would be good to have this as a toggle somewhere.
Like 'stretch with rect'.
There actually is a 'stretch ratio' property, but i've no idea what its supposed to do since changing it doesnt seem to do anything...

data.title: x11: analog triggers for ps4 gamepad
data.body:
I always wondered why the triggers are button events instead of axes for this pad.
Well, turns out the hardware sends both, but SDLs mapping chose to use the buttons...

data.title: Revert "Fix X11 Editor Boot Splash (Maximized Boot Splash)"
Input Events ignore Pause Mode
data.body:
According to the [tutorial on pausing](http://www.godotengine.org/projects/godot-engine/wiki/Pausing_The_Game), whenever the game is paused, `_process(delta)`, `_fixed_process(delta)`, `_input(event)`, and `_input_event(viewport, event, shape_idx)` will not be called.

Supposedly, for any nodes who have `PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS` set, those functions will still be called. And indeed, `_process(delta)`, `_fixed_process(delta)`, and `_input(event)` all appear to be called for any nodes who have `PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS` set even while the game is paused. But such nodes will not call `_input_event(viewport, event, shape_idx)` while paused, regardless of what the pause mode is set to. Instead they will just queue up all the events, and report them simultaneously when the game is unpaused.

Attached is an [Example](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/129364/Example.zip). It has two RigidBody2Ds which both inherit the same script. One is set to Pause Mode Stop, the other is set to Pause Mode Process.

While the game is unpaused, both nodes report clicks in general and clicks on themselves specifically. When the game is paused, the one with Process Mode Process will still report on any general clicks, but it will not report that it has been clicked. This seems against the spirit of `PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS`, and makes it impossible to tell when a node was clicked on while the game was paused.

When the game is unpaused, both nodes will report any clicks made on them as though they had just then happened, regardless of the pause setting.

This behavior occurs in both 1.1 Stable and 2.0 RC1 2016-02-09.

data.title: libudev packaging problems
data.body:
While reading through the irc backlogs I noticed this discussion (ping @punto- ):

```
<punto> can we statically link libudev.so? that one seems to not be as standard as the others
<punto> (for example it's not on the steam runtime, at least not the version that we use to build on the build server)
<Akien> punto: I have it in the steam runtime: /home/akien/.steam/steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/i386/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libudev.so.0
<Akien> punto: Don't you mean libevdev?
<Akien> punto: libevdev was dropped so shouldn't be an issue
<punto> yeah but the build server links with libudev.so.1
<punto> and package libudev0 doesn't exist anymore
<punto> could we do the same with udev? replace it with normal code?
<Akien> No idea
```

The following options came into my mind:
- Figure out a way to add statically linked libraries to the build system. Might come in handy in the future.
-  Add a code-path (enabled when libudev hasn't been found) that manually checks for joystick devices changes every (few) frame/s like the old code has. (`poll_joysticks()`, if you remember it ^^ )
- Try to load the symbols at runtime (like with xinput on windows)

data.title: zip/unzip files with GDScript
data.body: I'm looking for a way to zip files/folders and unzip .zip files in GDScript.

data.title: Tweening for progress bars
data.body: Right now Progress Bar and Texture Progress Bar don't have tweening functionality and steps on progress look kinda bad (especially when you have a range of, let's say, 1 to 20). Smooth progression in bars would be a very nice feature to have out of the box since they can be used not only to show loading progress, but to show HP and a lot of other UI stuff in game.

data.title: Doc: add list of possible return values to OS.get_name() description
data.body: So people don't have to look these up themselves when writing platform specific code in gdscript.

data.title: Ability to check from inside the function in which process it's called (fixed/idle)
data.body: Some functions don't work properly when they are called from idle process (for example when working with PhysicServer). It would be good to have ability to check in which process you are.

data.title: Add deep copy functions to Dictionary and Array
data.body:
Hi,
I found that there's no built-in way to deep-clone Dictionary or an Array.
I use these data structures for in-game templates that get data appended by instances, and I needed to clone them, completely and recursively.

The best way to do so right now, without writing an even clumsier / less efficient recursive function is to do it like so:

`dictionaryDeepCopy = str2var( var2str( originalDictionary ) )`

Please add `.copy()` method to both Dictionary and Array classes to make a deep / recursive copy of the object ( all elements / values should be deep-copied recursively as well )
